What we did Working principles

Hypotheses #7

We believe if we provide something that helps them calculate information

We'll see people better able to interpret the information and more accurately analyse and understand it

We’ll know this is true when we receive positive feedback from co-ordinators from user testing, ad hoc comments and as part of a quarterly survey

Related hypotheses

None

Considerations

  • Think about outcomes not solutions, people don’t want a complex calculation, they want information and assurance. What does the calculation give them?
  • More work is needed to identify what ‘calculations’ people need performing
  • Consider how information is presented so that people can understand it
  • It needs to be communicated clearly, using the language your users use
  • It should be iterated, tested and improved
  • Ensure accessibility is considered
